item.title: Configuring Hugo
item.description: Changing the logo Firstly to change your logo, put your svg in static/images/logo.svg. I used an png and put it through an online svg converter. Custom CSS To make a custom css file, we need to overwrite the css of the template. We don’t want delete the template of course. Run grep -r 'css' ./themes/cupper-hugo-theme/layouts from your hugo root dir. With this theme I got: ./themes/cupper-hugo-theme/layouts/partials/katex.html:<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/katex@0.10.1/dist/katex.min.css" integrity="sha384-dbVIfZGuN1Yq7/1Ocstc1lUEm+AT+/rCkibIcC/OmWo5f0EA48Vf8CytHzGrSwbQ" crossorigin="anonymous"> .
